Nobis Hotel Copenhagen Review | Bon Appetit

A high-end chain hotel that feels like a private residence, this luxury property is low-key in its stylish plushness, from the hoardable Byredo toiletries to the just-right blues and grays in your suite.THE VIBE IS: international creative travelers (who still have expense accounts).WORD TO THE WISE: Be sure to ask for a room overlooking the gorgeous Ny Carlsberg Glyptotek museum, visit the spa, hit the jaw-dropping breakfast buffet, and borrow one of their very cute bikes. And make use of the front desk staff: They’re incredibly helpful and at your beck and call.PRACTICAL STUFF: Rooms start at $475.—Christine MuhlkeWE ALSO LOVEHotel SandersHygge it up at this cozy boutique hotel near Copenhagen’s Royal TheatreNomaThe next evolution of René Redzepi’s destination restaurant in RefshaleøenHotel AlexandraTake home design tips from this midcentury City Hall Square hotel Explore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
